title: Plunderer
notes:
-ZR- is JPN BD Remux+PGS
Erai-raws is CR WEB-DL
There's also TTGA which has some TS but it's mistimed and only on the signs track, and is missing OP/ED lyrics that the PGS subs have
The JPN BD has the ugly signature Kadokawa grain, but the USA BD's grain is far worse and the web sources are unfortunately too starved despite looking much cleaner, deband helps significantly but not enough to save them. All the encodes are bad and lose to web.

title: Re:CREATORS
notes:
HorribleSubs is AMZN WEB-DL
AMZN quality sucks and it's missing BD changes, but it's the only existing release with proper subtitles.

The state of subtitles for this show is an absolute disgrace. Dragon-Releases used Beatrice-Raws sub release which is AMZN shifted to BD, with some extra lines present in BD translated from Japanese to Russian, then Russian to English
Dragon-Releases has countless errors reported in the comments, including issues which ruin major plot reveals. These issues are supposedly addressed in their v2 and v3 patches (which are just mega links with external fonts and sub files) but who knows if they fix everything. Can't really list something you need to mux and QC yourself in the alt section.

title: The Dawn of the Witch
notes:
Headpatter is VCB-Studio+LostYears (jnzngn for E1-9 and CR restyled with half-assed TS and jnzngn OP/ED for E10-12)
The sources for this show are all unwatchable, it's extremely grainy and even the blurays look like you're watching a mini encode. The USA BD is significantly less bad than the JPN but is still very starved in motion, and has other less important issues such as lowpassing and a chroma shift. VCB nukes all the grain away so the image is at least stable and consistent, it comes with a ton of detail loss but is really the only way to watch the show.

notes:
ANE is JPN BD Encode+UTW-Ryuumaru
All the encodes are pretty bad but at least ANE is muxed. The stores have an ugly starved layer of static grain which deband helps significantly with, particularly on the USA BD because it doesn't have an additional layer of grain added on top like the JPN BD. Additionally despite having a much lower bitrate, it often has better compression.
Store should be watched with MPV deband, but even without it's better than these encodes
